title: League client download going way past the limit
body:
So recently I had issues with opening the client, so I decided to redownload the client knowing that it would take a long time to download. 

In doing so I waited a couple of hours for the client to download. I went downstairs for a while,   but when I came back the downloading should have ended ages ago: but instead the MB goes way past the MB the client was supposed to fully download at. 

I dont really know if I'm making sense at the minute, so I have included a picture along with this. I would really love if someone helped me understand why my client download is doing this.. **Would really love to get back to enjoying league. c:**

PS - My internet is fine.

replies.body:
That usually happens when your network has some kind of a hiccup and it isn't actually downloading 100% correctly anymore. Due to that hiccup, the patcher lost track of where it was but kept counting regardless. Basically, this is a small kind of visual bug.

If it hasn't finished yet, I would go ahead and cancel it and restart with either an ethernet/hardwired connection or updating some of your [**network settings**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to make sure you're getting a smooth link with our download servers.

Thanks for replying back. Fortunately, it finished downloading however now that I have opened the client, for some strange reason I cant press play as its downloading whilst the client is downloading.
